#Text=Identify the Difference Between Synchronous and Asynchronous Activities
#Text=Learning environments can be categorized in two ways , synchronistic and asynchronistic .
#Text=With this article , you will learn the differences between then two .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Asynchronous
#Text=Defining asynchronous .
#Text=Asynchronous learning describes a learning environment where students can learn the same material at different times and in different places .
#Text=This is most commonly used in online schools or distance learning .
#Text=In the traditional classrooms asynchronous activities include projects , reports , and daily homework .
#Text=Asynchronous learning is very flexible .
#Text=This method offers additional time to complete work as the class is available around the clock .
#Text=Many mature students such as parents and working professionals prefer this method of learning as they are free to complete courses around their daily schedules .
#Text=There are numerous advantages of asynchronous learning .
#Text=This type of learning environment has proven to be quite successful when used by students with higher the average , disabled students , and international students .
#Text=The benefits include ;
#Text=Learning environment is available anytime and anyplace .
#Text=Allows student the opportunity for country wide or worldwide collaboration .
#Text=With less interruption from classmates , students have more time to reflect on the material .
#Text=Asynchronous online training requires a higher level of discipline and self-direction .
#Text=Each student is responsible for their individual learning .
#Text=Effective time management skills are an asset when determining time windows for assignments and postings .
#Text=Students may become easily distracted .
#Text=Asynchronous learning can pose some challenges to student , teachers and schools .
#Text=All parties involved with Asynchronous learning must be tech savvy and able to access the internet .
#Text=Successful learning in this environment hinges on how comfortable all parties are with the technology being used .
#Text=Other disadvantages include ;
#Text=Email or social media overload .
#Text=Written ideas may be misinterpreted .
#Text=Hardware and software can be costly .
#Text=Potential lack of input from students .
#Text=Synchronous
#Text=Defining
#Text=synchronous learning .
#Text=This is where students learn together at the same time , in the same place .
#Text=Traditionally , schools have used synchronous learning in classroom environments and lecture based teachings .
#Text=Increasingly , synchronous learning has been adapted for online classrooms as well .
#Text=These programs use tools such as web and video conferencing programs that accessed by students during set class times .
#Text=These classes usually have shorter deadlines for homework and readings assignments .
#Text=This type of learning is less flexible than asynchronous .
#Text=This may lead to missed deadlines or imbalance between school and home life .
#Text=With shorter deadlines and higher class sizes there is a potential for ineffective or lacking communications between students or collaborators .
#Text=Some students may benefit from the social aspect or synchronous learning .

#Text=Students studying in this style of learning environment may benefit from the communication that comes with a group setting , this is beneficial for reducing feelings of isolation while learning .
#Text=Students may also feel more engaged in this setting .
#Text=Immediate responses and feedback is available with synchronous learning .
#Text=Appropriate academic pacing is also present during this type of learning .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Ensure you are fully aware of the differences between traditional and Online training before engaging in future studies .
#Text=Ensure you are prepared for effective time management between work , home , studying , and reading .
#Text=Carefully chose which method is best for you by ;
#Text=Looking at previously established commitments to family and work .
#Text=Understanding how you learn best .
#Text=Subject matter you will be learning .
#Text=Your comfort level with the technology and programs being used .
